BattleCommands

Class Item

  • java.lang.Object
    • BattleCommands.BattleCommand
      • BattleCommands.Item
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Item>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbilityItem, HealthItem, StatusItem

    public abstract class Item
extends BattleCommand
implements java.lang.Comparable<Item>
    The item abstract class defines the abstract method useItem which is overridden by each specific subclass of Item. Beyond this to implement Encapsulation is manages all Item related inventory control. It is also abstract so the class cannot be used to create a stand alone object. Why? The Classes field that the item affects has yet to be defined.
    Author:
    Kevin

    • Constructor Detail

      • Item

        public Item(java.lang.String name,
            int effectStrength,
            Player player)
        Constructor to set the name, effect strength, and which player inventory this item belongs to.
        Parameters:
        name: - the name of the item
        effectStrength: - positive or negative effect strength of the item, the stat to which this item will affect is defined in it's appropriate subclass.
        player: - the player whose inventory this item belongs to

    • Method Detail

      • useBattleCommand

        public abstract void useBattleCommand(Hero hero,
                                      Hero target)
                               throws MaximumStatException
        Abstract method which will be defined in the subclasses dependent on their Heros field affected. The item will either increase a Heros field, or remove a Status effect from the Classes character.
        Specified by:
        useBattleCommand in class BattleCommand
        Parameters:
        target: - If offensive item will require a target, other wise will be given a null field
        Player: - player whose inventory will be adjusted
        hero: - here whose fields will be adjusted
        Throws:
        MaximumStatException: - Cannot use an item if it will not improve the hero's fields
        MaximumStatException

      • updateInventory

        public void updateInventory(Item item)
        Update the inventory count of an item. If the count is 0 the item is removed from the inventory.
        Parameters:
        item: - item whose count to update
